New Records: India scored their highest score of 411 in the tournament.
KL Rahul scored the fastest World Cup century in 62 balls.
Bas de Leede became the most successful Dutch bowler in the tournament, overtaking his father.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli contributed with medium pace in the 25th over.
Shubman Gill hit four sixes in the first 10 overs.
Rohit Sharma was dismissed after playing an ambitious pull.
Ravindra Jadeja proved tough for Dutch batters with his spin.
Teja Nidamanuru took a stunning catch to dismiss Shubman Gill.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first.
Netherlands had early wicket issues but showed resilience.
Post-Match Reflections: India's victory extended their consecutive wins to nine.
Netherlands reflected on their memorable World Cup journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's top four batters all scored over 50 runs.
15 boundaries were hit in the first Powerplay.
This was India's highest score in the World Cup.
Others: The match was part of the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
Both teams had unchanged lineups ahead of the final clash.
